channel.title: Help
channel.description:
Trying to register my server on the status page on my pc, but server is hosted on vps
Whats the link to verify your ip for statuspage
Normaly gives you a link to click to verify
Any one :S

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

download putty, in putty set the ssh connection details up (if your vps provider doesn’t allow ssh, cancel your payment and find a new one) and in connection go to ssh, in ssh go to tunnels, set the source port as 8080 (or whatever you prefer) and set it as dynamic, set destination as localhost and click add, it will look something like this

now, in firefox (finding the setting in another browser should be trivial) go to options, advanced then network, under connection click settings, click the option that allows for manual setup of proxy and under socks host put localhost, and for the port put 8080, click ok and you’re done

now, in putty click connect, what this does is create a proxy (on localhost:8080) so that any traffic that connects through localhost:8080 will go through your ssh tunnel on putty and will use your vps as a proxy, you can go to whatismyip.com to confirm your ip and then you can click your link

you’re welcome

EDIT: this will probably only work on a linux vps unless your windows vps has a ssh server

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:7, topic:444212”]explain the process of how you verify a server and I can help you out[/quote]You get a link that you need to visit from the box the server is being run on (it checks the IP)

OT - Try using your VPS as a proxy (you can Google some instructions), and then verifying from your home PC

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Hm… what type of VPS is it? I’m sure there is some hackery you could do with some command line browsing, but I couldn’t do it off the top of my head. If it’s a windows VPS, just use the browser and make the advertisement there?

VPS.[/quote]
